metadata.dc:title: Deep vein thrombosis related to Campylobacter fetus bacteriemia
metadata.dc:creator: Lucena Calvet, P
Priego de Montiano, P
Membrillo de Novales, F. J
Perea Perea, C
metadata.dc:description: We present a patient who was admitted with symptoms of disorientation, fever, and diarrheal stools. E xamination and laboratory tests showed a deep vein thrombosis in the left leg, and isolation of C. fetus in blood cultures taken during a fever peak. T he association of C. fetus with thromboembolic events has been reported, but we haven’t found any cases in our biliograpich search describing this association confirmed by the isolation of the organism in blood cultures, except for a ovaric vein thrombosis (AU)
metadata.dc:title: Trombosis venosa profunda asociada a bacteriemia por campylobacter fetus
